meanings.definition: Sign or endorse (a document) at the bottom.
meanings.sent1: She always undersigns her letters with a flourish.
meanings.sent2: The author undersigns each copy of his book before sending it out.
meanings.sent3: The cat undersigns the adoption papers with a paw print.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the cause undersigns every action he takes.
meanings.sent5: The artist's signature undersigns the masterpiece, making it truly his own.

meanings.definition: A person who signs a document at the bottom.
meanings.sent1: The undersigns on the contract were clear and legible.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer confirmed the identity of the undersigns on the will.
meanings.sent3: The undersigns at the meeting were all eager to finalize the agreement.
meanings.sent4: As the undersigns of the treaty, they held great responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The undersigns of the petition represented a united voice for change.
